creator: azverkan@yahoo.com
text:
Upon configuring the HEAD of the httpd2 trunk, I get a hang immediately after
the message "checking for AIX", at this point the build process is running the
"yes" command and if I kill this command the build process errors the rest of
the way out.

If I manually pass the line EGREP="grep -E" on the ./configure line, it won't
hang checking for AIX and configure succesfully completes.


Debian Sarge
  make 3.80-9
  grep 2.5.1.dsl-4
  autoconf 2.59a-3

httpd2, apr, and apr-util are all from SVN trunk

srclib contains apr, apr-util, and pcre

Output from configure after APR and APR-UTIL finish:



Applying OS-specific hints for httpd ...

  forcing SINGLE_LISTEN_UNSERIALIZED_ACCEPT to "1"
  forcing AP_NONBLOCK_WHEN_MULTI_LISTEN to "1"
checking for rm... /bin/rm
checking for pkg-config... /usr/bin/pkg-config
checking for rsync... /usr/bin/rsync
checking for gawk... no
checking for mawk... mawk
checking whether ln -s works... yes
checking for ranlib... ranlib
checking for lynx... no
checking for links... links
checking for AIX...
This should be fixed already as of r328852, svn up and re-run buildconf.
creator: jorton@redhat.com
